events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred last night involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords such as vehicle and collision mentioned in the filed report.
An agent was assigned to the case promptly to handle the car accident claim and initiate further investigation.
The customer was formally acknowledged that their car accident claim was received and is being processed.
The claimant was asked to submit vehicle registration, photos of the damaged car, and police report related to the accident.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the car damage and official accident report.
Investigation into the auto accident claim commenced to verify the extent of damage and liability based on submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and collision caused significant vehicle damage.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer offering compensation for repairs and rental car expenses during vehicle downtime.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the prompt attention and fair settlement offer.
Claim approval was confirmed following the customer agreement on the settlement amount for their auto accident damages.
The payment covering all repair costs and associated expenses was processed and transferred to the claimantâ€™s account.
The auto accident claim case was officially closed after full settlement and customer confirmation of receipt.
All claim documents and communication logs were archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
